page.title: 05Changes in Royston
page.content: Royston has changed a lot during the twentieth century. The town has grown in all directions and now is about five times the size. Many of the open fields have been built upon to make new housing estates. Old paths and country lanes have been made into big roads and streets. There are lots of new shops and schools. Tannery Drift school is only 25 years old and Roysia school is only 10. Nearly all of the old shops have been turned into new ones. The old chalkpits, the workhouse and the brewery have gone, but Royston has an industrial estate where many people work. Royston continues to change. Every year some of the shops change and new streets and houses are built. In 1980 a by-pass road was completed round the town.
